de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing

Class SingleWordStage

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.stage.Window
      • javafx.stage.Stage
        • de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing.SingleWordStage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DbEditingUserFeedback, UserFeedbackProvider, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class SingleWordStage
extends javafx.stage.Stage
implements DbEditingUserFeedback

    This small undecorated, dialogue-like stage provides simple offline editing functionality of a single TranscriptionItem. It features the AddTranscriptionPane and a ToolBar on its bottom side. Said functionality is not restricted to those users who are authorised to modify the online database. Instead, everybody may employ this feature, for example by selecting the 'Free Input' option in a WordButton's context menu.

    Important: As already stated, the editing capabilities of this class are strictly limited to offline usage. This means that any alteration of the database will be overwritten as soon as it is updated the next time.

    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)
    See Also:
    OfflineHandler, AddTranscriptionPane

      • generalFeedback

        public void generalFeedback(FeedbackMode mode,
                            java.lang.String feedback)
        Description copied from interface: UserFeedbackProvider
        The most basic way of giving the user feedback by displaying the given String. To facilitate programming, information about an operation's success, failure, error state, etc. may directly be read from the first paramter. This also allows for visual representations, such as warning signs or similar iconic codings.
        Specified by:
        generalFeedback in interface UserFeedbackProvider
        Parameters:
        mode - indicates the nature of the feedback.
        feedback - a message that the user may receive.
